abstract: Funeral is held for three police officers who died in terror attacks in Paris, while Israel buries four Jews killed at supermarket; French leaders take steps against further attacks on day of mourning and defiance.
lead_paragraph: Three coffins draped in the French tricolor were laid out in Paris as tribute was paid to the officers who died. In Jerusalem, four other victims were buried.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Daphné Anglès from Paris, Mariana Ionova from London, Alison Smale and Melissa Eddy from Berlin, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem.
byline.original: By ALAN COWELL and MAÏA de la BAUME

snippet: Three coffins draped in the French tricolor were laid out in Paris as tribute was paid to the officers who died. In Jerusalem, four other victims were buried.

headline.main: France Mourns Attack Victims and Takes Steps Against Further Terrorism
headline.print_headline: France Mourns Attack Victims and Takes Steps Against Further Terrorism
